subject: Leadership
title: Burnout Psychology
description: A micro-lesson that makes Burnout Psychology usable.

hook.text: A top performer quits suddenly. She seemed fine last week. But burnout doesn't announce itself. It builds silently.

buildup.text: Maslach defines burnout in three parts: exhaustion, cynicism, and reduced efficacy. It's not just being tired.

discovery.text: Six causes: overload, lack of control, insufficient reward, unfairness, isolation, and values conflict. Fix the system.

twist.text: Self-care advice misses the point. Burnout is a systemic problem, not a personal one. Yoga won't fix a toxic culture.

climax.text: Leaders prevent burnout by managing workload, giving autonomy, and ensuring people feel valued and fairly treated.

punchline.text: Burnout is not a people problem. It's a leadership problem.

quiz.question: What are the three components of burnout according to Maslach?
